snippet: Have you heard about Clown-and-Cheesegate? It’s quite a story about the high cost of bonding over shrimp in Las Vegas.
abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column lampoons the excesses of a conference held in Las Vegas in 2010 by the General Services Administration’s Public Buildings Service, which has become the subject of a stinging report by the organization's inspector general and precipitated the resignation of GSA head Martha Johnson; recommends that the GSA hold its future meetings in the same federal buildings they are responsible for managing.
lead_paragraph: Have you heard about Clown-and-Cheesegate? It’s quite a story about the high cost of bonding over shrimp in Las Vegas.

headline.print_headline: Send In The Clowns, And Cheese
headline.seo: Send In the Clowns, and Cheese
headline.main: Send in the Clowns, and Cheese
